title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.14.6 - 8 | 8-11-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya
Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmay Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvijesha Shunyavadi Pachatyade Shatharine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shri Vasadi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam
Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 6th verse of the 14th chapter of the 1st canto of Shri Mudbhagavatam
Yudhishthira Uvacha Sampreshito Dvarakayam Jisnur Bandhu Didrikshaya
Jnatum Cha Punya Shlokasya Krishnasya Cha Vicheshtitam
The meaning of this verse is Maharaj Yudhishthira said to his younger brother Bhima Sena
I sent Arjuna to Dvaraka to meet his friends and to learn from the personality of God Krishna
of his program.
So Yudhishthira begins to describe to Bhima what's happening.
First of all he says I sent Yudhishthira, Arjuna to Dvaraka for what to find out what is Krishna's
next program and in the next verse the 7th verse Krishna Yudhishthira continues to say
speak to Bhima.
Gata Saptadhuna Masa Bhima Sena Tabanujaha Nayatikasyava Hetor Naham Vedaida Manjasa
The meaning of this 7th verse is since he departed 7 months have passed.
When did Yudhishthira send Arjuna?
Seven months back.
Yet he has not returned.
I do not know factually.
How things are going on there in Dvaraka.
How things are going on I do not know.
The 8th verse Api devarshina diṣṭaha sakāloyaṁ upasthitaha yadātmano angam ākṛdam
bhagavān utsi srikshati.
The meaning of this verse is.
Is he going to quit his earthly pastimes as Devarshi Narada indicated?
Has the time already arrived?
Again Yudhishthira is conjecturing that Krishna has disappeared.
Only then there was a reason for all such symptoms to appear.
So he is again trying to confirm by asking Bhima.
Is the soul still alive?
Yes.
Is the Supreme Lord going to quit his earthly pastimes?
And some mention was made about Devarshi Narada.
In the previous chapter it is described Narada had told Yudhishthira you Pandavas should
remain on this earth as long as the Supreme Lord is present.
Which means that after the disappearance of Supreme Lord you should also quit your position
on this earthly planet.
Yes.
He also stated that Pralaya montre protege sw Grandi BhoĄ Madonna".
So that is exactly what is being referred here as Devarshi Narada had indicated has the Supreme
Lord quit his earthly pastimes.
So Srila Prabhupada writes elaborate purport to this particular verse Srila Prabhupada
says.
As we have discussed many times.
the Supreme Personality of Godhead Lord.
Krishanah.
plenary expansions. What is the meaning of plenary expansion? Krishna is the unlimited
personality of Godhead. He expands. That means he is one person, but he is simultaneously present
in many forms. He himself is present in many forms. And such expansions are called plenary
expansions when Krishna's full power is present in each of the expanded forms.
Just like Krishna expands, first of all, as Balaram. So Balaram is Krishna only,
but Balaram has the full power of Krishna. Balaram is Krishna. But we say he is Balaram
because he is Krishna. So we say he is Krishna. So we say he is Krishna. So we say he is Krishna.
he has got different function he's got different he displays different varied
characteristics he has specific pastimes he has specific relationships he has
specific characteristics and all appear to be distinctly different from
Krishna's own appearance characteristics qualities activities appear to be different
so Krishna the Supreme personality of God has many plenary expansions we can't
count how many plenary expansions are there and each and every one of them
each and every plenary expansion
although equally powerful executes different functions if it were for the
same function there is no need Krishna is all-powerful so for different
functions different forms that is Krishna's own personal opulence now
Srila Prabhupada quotes the Bhagavad Gita in Bhagavad Gita there are
different statements by the Lord and each of these statements is meant for
different plenary portions or portions of the plenary portions some of them
Srila Prabhupada cites here for example Shri Krishna the Lord says in Bhagavad
Gita in the fourth chapter seventh verse what does he say whenever in
wherever there is a decline in religious practice or descendant of
Bharata and a predominant rise of irreligion at the time I descend myself
yada yadahi dharmasya glanir bhavati bhavati that verse is being cited by
Prabhupada the English translation of that verse, so at different times Krishna has
different incarnations appear so these incarnations are
possible
plenary portions, or they are portions of plenary portions, amsa and kala. Then again,
in the fourth chapter, eighth verse, Krishna says, to deliver the faithful, to annihilate
the miscreants, and also to reestablish the principles of occupational duty, I appear
in every age. In every yuga, Krishna incarnates for three purposes, and those are mentioned
here. Now these incarnations are different plenary expansions, different plenary portions,
different portions of the plenary portions. They come time to time. Each of the incarnations
come appropriately.
Then again, in the third chapter, twenty-fourth verse, Krishna says, if I should cease to
work, then all humanity would be misdirected. I would also be the cause of creating unwanted
population, and I would thereby destroy the peace of all sentient beings. So this also,
Krishna is speaking.
But, in his different expansions, different incarnations, he performs different activities.
Not all incarnations are doing the same thing. Just like in his expansion as Mahavishnu,
he is responsible for the primary creation, breathing out universes, and breathing in
the universes.
Then, as in the server- Meng Bo Tao in the third chapter, and his third chapter, it starts
by
will follow and whatever standards he sets by exemplary acts all the world pursues. Particularly
Krishna incarnates, he teaches by his own example certain things. In every incarnation
he teaches by his example. So that is being referred to here, different incarnations,
different forms, different activities, different purposes, Krishna appears in different incarnations.
So now Prabhupada continues after citing these four verses from the Bhagavad Gita, Prabhupada
says, all the above statements by the Lord apply to different plenary portions of the
Lord, namely his expansions such as Sankarsana, Vasudeva, Pradyumna, Aniruddha, Narayana,
Sankara. These are all he himself in different transcendental expansions. Krishna only,
only one person, supreme person, unlimited person. He is not ordinary person like us.
Transcendental personality full of all so many opulences, so many powers, so many different
forms.
Still the Lord and Shri Krishna functions in a different sphere of transcendental exchange
with different grades of devotees. As Krishna himself, he also appears. And that appearance
is the appearance of the original personality we have got it. In Mathura, he is born and
then he transfers himself to Vrindavan and then again comes back to Mathura, then Dwaraka,
so different sphere of transcendental exchange with different grades of devotees, different
types of devotees are there. And yet Lord Krishna as he is appears once every 24 hours
of Brahma's time, once in a day or after a lapse of 8 billion 640 million solar years.
This one day and night of Brahma together is unparalleled.
In our calculation on the earth, 8 billion 640 million, so many solar years elapse after
Krishna appears again. In each and every universe Krishna appears once in the day of Brahma.
And all his transcendental pastimes are displayed in each and every universe in a routine spool.
Just like cinema is running.
Like that.
Every Brahmanda, Krishna will appear, perform his pastimes and disappear. Once in a day
of Brahma only. In his form as Krishna. Of course, in his other forms, other expansions,
other incarnations he appears in so many different yugas in different times. But in that routine
spool the functions of Lord Krishna, Lord Vasudeva, etc. are complex problem for the layman.
A layman cannot understand. It is the same personality of God that is appearing.
There is no difference between the Lord's self and the Lord's transcendental body.
This is important.
Krishna's body and Krishna's soul are identical.

Thus, the Lord Krishna of Vrindavan is different from the Lord Krishna of Mathura.
Different means a different expansion is present in Mathura, a different expansion is present
in Dwaraka, a different expansion is present in some other Leela.
The Viratrupa of Lord Krishna is also different from him by his inconceivable potency.
Krishna showed his Viratrupa to Arjuna on the battlefield of Kurukshetra, but Krishna
is sitting and Arjuna is seeing the Viratrupa and Arjuna is talking to Krishna.
So Krishna is there, Viratrupa is also there.
Inconceivably they can be one and they can be different.
The Viratrupa exhibited on the battlefield of Kurukshetra is a material conception of
his form.
It is not his totality.
It is a transcendental form, Viratrupa is a material conception of form.
Therefore it should be understood that when Krishna apparently was killed by the bow and
arrow of the hunter, the Lord left his so-called material body in the material world.
So what did Krishna leave behind?
For the atheist it appears like Krishna was killed by the hunter, but what did he leave
behind?
When we die, we leave behind our body.
Krishna went and killed his own body.
He came and killed the body, Krishna says leave behind our material body.
Krishna also apparently left behind a material body.
Krishna has no material body, he has no material form, then what did we leave behind?
So, he left behind, that is explained here that he left behind his Viratrupa in the material

And Viratrupa belongs to the material world and he left behind that Viratrupa.
